definition:
The metric space $(X,\,d)$ is called an [*ultrametric space*]{}, if its
metric $d$ is an ultrametric, i.e. if
$$d(x,\,z) \leqq \max \{d(x,\,y),\,d(y,\,z)\} \quad \forall x,\,y,\,z\in X.$$

**Example.** The field $\mathbb{Q}$ together with any of its $p$-adic
metrics $$d_p(x,\,y) = |x-y|_p,$$ where $|\cdot|_p$ is the of
$\mathbb{Q}$, forms an ultrametric space.
